div.p: O, Friend of my young years, and all my years
From youth to gray-haired age! How glad my heart
That yet I see thee here, and that Death's dark
The fated stroke to thee -- to both -- forbears!
I am like courser fleeter that noon nears
The destined goal, though later was my start;
And no, co-equal, we approach the mark
Where we shall barter this poor vale of Tears
For that eternal kingdom where decay
And pain, and sorrow, enter nevermore!
So, hand in hand, let us in joy descend
The verdant shore of age, and find our way
Across death's darksome streak unto the shore
Where Life, and youth, and bliss shall never end!
